text:
This article is about the 2018 sequel series. For the 2009–2012 original series, see Jersey Shore (TV series)

Jersey Shore: Family Vacation is an American reality television series that premiered on MTV globally on April 5, 2018.

The series follows seven housemates from the original Jersey Shore as they spend a month living together in Miami, Florida.[1]

On February 28, 2018, a second season was ordered ahead of the series premiere,[2] which filmed in Las Vegas, Seaside Heights, Manalapan, and Atlantic City. The second season premiered on August 23, 2018.[3]

On December 13, 2018, MTV renewed the series for a third season, which premiered on July 11, 2019.[4]

Lauren Sorrentino (season 1–3)

Jen Harley (guest season 1; recurring season 2)

Production [ edit ]

Development and filming [ edit ]

On November 27, 2017, MTV announced that the cast (with the exception of Sammi) would be reuniting in Miami, Florida, for a new reunion season titled Jersey Shore: Family Vacation.[35] The series premiered globally on April 5, 2018.

It was reported in January, 2019 that filming for Season 3 had begun.[36][37] It is scheduled to begin airing in Summer 2019. No exact release date has been announced.[38] In May 2019, Vinny Guadagnino confirmed that much filming had completed prior to Michael Sorrentino’s incarceration, including Mr. Sorrentino’s wedding, court sentencing, and the time leading up to his incarceration.[39] Ending previous speculation of whether Sorrentino would be able to appear in the season.[37]
